events.description: ​OTWC is an NYC-based writing community for online writers to write, exchange ideas, and get inspired. Our sessions look like this:​​​​​​​​​​​1. ​​​Introduce yourselves and talk about what you plan to write2. ​​​Focused writing session3. ​​​Get together in small groups and discuss how the session went​​​​​​​​​​​Snacks and drinks will be provided!​​​​​​​​​​If this price is too steep for you for any reason, email us by clicking "Contact the Host" on the left and we’ll give you a pay-what-you-can ticket.​​​​​​​​​​​Follow us on Twitter and Instagram @otwc_nyc to stay updated on future events and announcements!​​​​​​​​​​​Hope to see you there 🥳

events.name: Data In Power - NYC Event
events.description: ​Data and the distribution of decision-making power is an increasingly important dynamic to understand and engage with in climate and energy. ​At Data In Power, we believe the method AND end product of data (collection, analysis, and visualization) are critical to decision-making.How are data being collected, analyzed, and presented - why, and by whom? These are the hard-hitting questions we are unpacking.​At this monthly social, we discuss Data In Power fundamentals in a casual setting. **Format**: We will meet for an hour group discussion followed by an optional social hour. Here is avideowith some background on Data In Power's focus within data and the distribution of decision-making power. At all of our events, we gather our community of data and decision-making experts and enthusiasts within climate and energy to share our perspectives.​​Data In Power is an independently run meetup without any bells and whistles.In order to maintain community and continue organic growth, prospective attendees should be prepared to support our meetup venue with a purchase, regardless of how large or small. Data In Power brings folks together through meaningful, productive, and unique programming.

venue.name: Please register to see the exact location of this event.

events.name: 106th NY Hardware Meetup @ Cornell Tech
events.description: ​The Hardware Meetup community is excited to announce the 106th NY Hardware Meetup at Cornell Tech​​​​Hardware Meetups happen across 30+ cities around the world, bringing together hardware professionals to network and learn from each other. You might not realize it, but NYC is a hotbed for this kind of innovation and tonight you'll meet two companies working at the cutting edge of this technology.​​​​This month we'll be atCornell Tech. Cornell Tech is  Cornell University’s state-of-the-art campus in New York City that develops leaders and technologies for the AI era through foundational and applied research, graduate education, and new ventures. Located on Roosevelt Island, the growing campus was founded in partnership with the Technion-Israel Institute of Technology and in close collaboration with the NYC Economic Development Corporation after Cornell won a worldwide competition initiated by Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg’s administration to create an applied sciences campus in New York City. More than 1,000 Cornell students are now educated annually on the campus, including 700 in Cornell Tech programs. Since opening in 2012, nearly 120 new companies have spun out from startup programs at Cornell Tech, and 95 percent of them are based in New York City. Cornell Tech continues to have atransformative economic impact on the region’s tech sector.​For information on how to get to the event:https://tech.cornell.edu/visit-us/​AGENDA​​​​6:30 - Arrival, presentation of student demos​​​​7:00 - Welcome and introduction​​7:15- Community open mic​​​​Anyone will have the chance or talk about what they are working on​7:30 - Panel with audience Q+A​​8:40 - Student demos, makerlab tours, mix and mingle​THANK YOU TO OUR SPONSOR​​​EastBridgewas founded in 2003 to provide original equipment manufacturers, product designers and entrepreneurs with on-the-ground manufacturing management and related services in the Asia-Pacific Eastern Europe and North American regions. We guide manufacturing projects in China, Eastern Europe, Hong Kong, Indonesia, Japan, Korea, Malaysia, Mexico, Singapore, Taiwan, Thailand, Vietnam and many other locations throughout the world. Our team of engineers, scientists and trade & logistics specialists manage the complexities of new product development, production scale-up, quality assurance and global logistics billed using seamless and transparent time-and-materials business model. The EastBridge staff offers decades of experience in manufacturing engineering & procurement, international trade and contract management. All have worked for multinational companies and have degrees in engineering, material science, international trade or accounting and are highly proficient in English and other languages.​Welcome Remarks​Niti Parikhis the founding director of Cornell Tech’s academic MakerLAB and an Engaged Faculty Fellow, with over 15 years of experience in Interior Architecture and Sustainable Manufacturing. Her work centers on participatory design in Digital Fabrication, creating inclusive learning environments that empower people of all ages and abilities to bring their ideas to life.​​PANELISTS​Jack Danielsis the founder and president of the EastBridge family of companies. His career has focused on developing new technologies and products, industrializing them and then bringing them to market. Before founding EastBridge, Jack worked for SME as well as large public companies. His experience includes launching and growing advanced materials and electronic interconnect oriented companies overseas. This work allowed him to live in South Korea and China. Our work is now centered on bringing our clients' emerging products through DFMA (design for manufacturing and assembly), industrialization, volume manufacturing and distribution. Half of our projects are medical device and healthcare related, with the balance in automotive, consumer, electronics, industrial, motion control, sensors and transportation. What ties all of our projects together is our clients' need to move their designs quickly from prototype to production.​Doug Marsdenis the Chief Technology Officer and Managing Member of Eleven, LLC, a Boston-based, multi-disciplinary product development studio he co-founded in 1996. With over three decades of experience, he leads Eleven in delivering award-winning, human-centered design solutions across industries including consumer goods, medical devices, and electronics. Doug also serves as an Operating Partner at Pennant Equity Partners, where he provides hands-on expertise in product development and innovation, helping small to medium-sized businesses unlock growth and operational excellence. His career reflects a commitment to purposeful, business-building innovation and cross-disciplinary collaboration.​Ben Zvaifleris the Founder and CEO of Cloud Water Filters, a consumer hardware company transforming residential water filtration. He previously founded PupBox, a DTC pet brand featured on Shark Tank and later acquired by Petco. Ben is an expert in startup growth, operations, and product development.​WANT TO GET INVOLVED?​​​Sponsorship:​We offer exclusive access to our 10,000+ member community through sponsorships.​​​Host an event at your space:We are always looking for host sponsors to provide access to unique spaces from cool hardware companies building interesting things. Want to open up your office?​​​Speaker:Do you have something interesting to share with our community? We're on the lookout for fresh faces to talk about their journey and experiences.​​​If you want to get involved, head here:https://linktr.ee/nyhardware

events.name: La Creme de la STEM™ x Startup Grind DMV - Walk and Talk
events.description: ​Join La Creme de la STEM™ and Startup Grind for a relaxed evening of networking and conversation at our "Walk and Talk" event, happening during SelectUSA at the Gaylord National Resort & Convention Center. Whether you're an entrepreneur or investor located in the DMV area, or attending SelectUSA, this is your chance to connect with like-minded professionals, exchange ideas, and build meaningful relationships in a casual, welcoming atmosphere.​This gathering is the perfect opportunity to unwind after a busy day, share your experiences, and explore new opportunities. We look forward to seeing you there!​ABOUT LA CREME DE LA STEM™​​​La Creme de la STEM™is the only global, private network for early-stage female founders in tech and science, offering a holistic support system that includes exclusive insights from exited entrepreneurs, vetted investors and perks from corporate partners.Applyto join!

events.name: Female Founders Unwind - La Creme de la STEM™
events.description: ​Join us for unwinding in great company during New York Tech Week! Show up as you are, honore where you are at and mingle with fellow female founders.​AGENDA:​9 - 9:30am: checkin and networking​9:30 - 9:45: pitches of Founding Members of La Creme de la STEM™​Abby Rakshit, CEO and Founder at Season​9:45 - 10am: breath and relax with Lizzy of Sync N​10am - 11am: networking​​ABOUT LA CREME DE LA STEM™:​​​La Creme de la STEM™is the only global, private network for early-stage female founders in tech and science, offering a holistic support system that includes exclusive insights from exited entrepreneurs, vetted investors and perks from corporate partners.Applyto join!​ABOUT CITIZENS​Citizens Private Bankprovides holistic, high-touch client service to startups, venture capital, and private equity firms. We are a trusted partner to established venture capital funds & emerging managers, founders, and LP's, and corporates for Citizens Private Bank. We offer tailored financial solutions and expert guidance. With a rich legacy of supporting innovation and entrepreneurship, we specialize in providing comprehensive banking services to meet the unique needs of the innovation economy with an unprecedented customer service and support.

events.name: 🕯️ Pour & Shake: Candle & Mocktail Making Class
events.description: ​Hey friends! This event is sold out, and unfortunately we don’t have a waitlist function. Keep an eye out for future events!​——​Join us for an evening of Candle & Mocktail Making at Nose Best - Bushwick’s secret speakeasy candle pouring studio!​We’ll kick off the night in the Nose Best store with a glass of (non-alcoholic) prosecco by St Buena Vida before heading to their speakeasy candle studio in the back.​You’ll start by blending your own signature candle scent and hand-pouring a candle to take home. Then, shake things up with a curated mocktail making experience led by Sam from Third Place Bar.​You’ll head home with your ownhandmade candle, afull size bottle of St. Buena Vida bubbly, and agoodie bag of cocktail garnishesfrom Small Batch Cocktail Co to set the mood for your next night in 🥰​Whether you’re sober-curious, alcohol-free, or just looking for a new kind of night out, this cozy, hands-on class is the perfect vibe.​Limited spots available.Come solo, bring a friend, or plan your next date night!​FAQ​​​Q: Do I need to be there at the exact start time?Yes, please aim to arrive at 6.30pm as we will get started with the class at 7pm and latecomers may not be admitted!​​​​Q: Can I come alone?Yes, you’re welcome to come alone and meet new people!​​​​Q: Is this an alcohol-free venue?Yes, the studio does not serve alcohol.​​​​Q: Is there an age restriction?Yes, all our events are 21+​​​Q: I need to cancel, can I get a refund for my ticket?Unfortunately, we cannot offer refunds, but you're welcome to pass on your ticket to someone else.

events.name: Third Place Bar x Shanti House Mindful Friday Night Social
events.description: ​Third Place Bar & Shanti Houseinvite to you a different kind of Friday night out. Join us at the new Fabrik location in Dumbo for a relaxing and slowfirst timers yoga class(aimed at anyone who isn’t familiar with yoga), light snacks, a tea bar byMOOSA, non-alcoholic drinks and a live DJ to wind down and de-stress from the week... without the hangover.​What to expect:​6.30pm-7pm: Arrivals & mingling(please make sure to arrive on time before the yoga session!)​7pm-7.45pm: Unwind yin yoga led byShanti House​7.45pm-8.30pm: Social hour with NA drinks​Limited spots available. Our last Friday Night Social sold out a week before the event date, so please make sure to grab your ticket early!​FAQ​​Q: Do I need to be there at the exact start time?Yes, please aim to arrive at 6.30pm as we will begin the yoga class at 7pm and latecomers may not be admitted!​​​Q: Can I come alone?Yes, this is a social mixer, you’re welcome to come alone and meet new people!​​​Q: Is this an alcohol-free venue?Yes, Fabrik is a community space that does not serve alcohol.​​​Q: Is there an age restriction?Yes, all our events are 21+​Q: I've never done yoga, can I still come?Yes! This yoga class is specifically aimed at folks who haven’t done yoga and aren’t familiar with the poses. We’ll keep the poses simple and walk you through them!​Q: Do I need to bring a mat? Can I change somewhere?Yoga mat rental is included in the ticket price, but you're welcome to bring your own! There are limited changing rooms available.​Q: I need to cancel, can I get a refund for my ticket?Unfortunately, we cannot offer refunds, but you're welcome to pass on your ticket to someone else.​​​Please note: By signing up for this event you agree to receive email communication from us. You can opt out any time.

events.name: Sober(Curious) Cinco de Mayo Party
events.description: ​We're back with another hangover-free party, and this time we’re celebrating our Mexican friends & neighbors on Cinco de Mayo! 🇲🇽​Expect drinks from some of our favorite Mexican produced and Latin owned brands: cocktail specials with non-alc tequila by Tomonotomo, 🍃 infused drinks by Cloudwalker Farm, and NA palomas and mojitos by JAS!​We’ll also have a ton of Mexican snacks 🍬, music, conversation starter cards, and MAYBE the bedazzle station will make a comeback too! ✨​There’s no fixed programming at this event. Come through any time and be ready to mingle with new people!​This event is supported byCloudwalker Farm!​There’s no dress code this time, but you’re encouraged to dress up & dress colorful! We kindly ask you to respect Mexican culture and not dress up in costume. The organizing team for this event is not Mexican, and we’re  trying to avoid cultural appropriation.​FAQ​​Q: Do I need to be there at the exact start time?No, you can stop by at the party any time!​​​Q: Can I come alone?Yes, this is a social mixer, you’re welcome to come alone and meet new people!​​​Q: Can I bring friends?Yes, butplease send them the link to RSVPso we can manage the venue capacity (!!), send them important updates, and ensure a great experience for all!​​​Q: Is this a sober venue?Yes, Hekate is a 100% sober bar.​Q: Will there be food?Hekate doesnotserve food, and it will likely be too tight and busy to bring in takeout! There are plenty of bars and restaurants in the neighborhood that have great options for a quick snack or dinner.​​​Q: Is there an age restriction?Yes, all our events are 21+​​​Q: Is there a cover charge?No, there is no cover charge, but we encourage you to purchase drinks to support us and the venue & tip the lovely bar staff so we can continue hosting these kinds of events!

events.name: AAPI Gen Z Founder + Creator Pop-Up
events.description: ​AAPI Gen Z Founder + Creator Pop-up​Hosted at Kiehl's Flagship Store​Friday, May 16th, 2025 | 3:00-4:30pm​Event Overview​Join us for an exclusive afternoon showcasing the best AAPI Gen Z founders and creators! This curated marketplace event brings together innovative Asian American and Pacific Islander entrepreneurs all under one roof at the iconic Kiehl's Flagship Store.​Experience products, meet the visionaries behind emerging brands, and connect with a community of forward-thinking entrepreneurs and creators. Perfect for networking, discovering new brands, and capturing content in beautiful natural lighting.​About GenZtea​GenZtea is a community platform connecting diverse Gen Z founders, entrepreneurs, and creators through exclusive events, networking opportunities, and resource sharing. Founded with the mission of amplifying underrepresented voices in business, GenZtea hosts regular mixers, panels, and coworking events that help emerging entrepreneurs build meaningful connections, gain visibility, and access mentorship opportunities.​About Foundess​Foundess is an accelerator initiative for female and non-binary Gen Z entrepreneurs, providing early-stage support, funding connections, and business development resources. Through our targeted programming, we help women and non-binary founders navigate the unique challenges they face in the startup ecosystem while building a supportive community of peers and mentors.​Featured Collaboration: NYC Tech Week Female Founders Series A+ Event​GenZtea and Foundess are proud to present our exclusive NYC Tech Week event for female founders who have raised Series A or $1M+ at Isshiki Matcha. This premier networking and resource-sharing initiative is generously sponsored by Citizens Bank, Morpheus, and Lowenstein Sandler.​All AAPI Pop-up attendees are welcome to join our Female Founders event:https://partiful.com/e/W0Cg0SbD39bbKt5FrXZk​What to Expect​Meet 2+ AAPI-owned brands and their founders​Sample and shop exclusive AAPI-owned products​Network with fellow entrepreneurs and creators​Free skin consultation + hydration check by Kiehl's employees​Featured Brands​Isshiki Matcha​Full list of participating brands to be announced soon​Sponsorship Opportunities​Interested in sponsoring this event? We offer various partnership packages that connect your brand with influential Gen Z founders and creators. For sponsorship inquiries, please contact: natalie@thegenztea.com​Location​Kiehl's Flagship Store​Space is limited. Please RSVP to secure your spot.

venue.name: 109 3rd AveNew York, NY 10003, USA

events.name: NYC Tech Week Prayer Walk
events.description: ​NYC Tech Week Prayer Walk​A Co-hosted Event by  GenZtea, Tech Walk, and Christians in Tech​Join us for a moment of mindfulness before the hustle of NYC Tech Week​Start your NYC Tech Week experience with intention and community. Join fellow tech professionals, entrepreneurs, and innovators for a guided prayer walk along Manhattan's iconic High Line park.​Event Details​Date:Saturday, June 1st, 2025Time:3:00 PM ESTMeeting Point:Shake Shack at Hudson YardsEnd Point:Chelsea Market​What to Expect​Our journey will begin with a group prayer at Hudson Yards, followed by a reflective walk along the elevated High Line park. As we stroll through this urban oasis, we'll have the opportunity to connect, share intentions for the week ahead, and enjoy breathtaking views of the city.​We'll conclude our walk at Chelsea Market with a final prayer of gratitude and intention-setting for NYC Tech Week.​Who This Is For​This event focuses on Christian founders and investors in the tech community, creating space for faith-centered networking and reflection. However, we warmly welcome participants of all backgrounds and beliefs who are interested in starting NYC Tech Week with intentionality and community.​Why Join?​Center yourself before the busy conference schedule​Network with like-minded professionals in a relaxed setting​Experience a unique perspective of NYC​Set meaningful intentions for your Tech Week experience​What to Bring​Comfortable walking shoes​Water bottle​Open mind and heart​This event is open to all, regardless of faith background or tradition. Our focus is on community, mindfulness, and setting positive intentions for the week ahead.​Register now to reserve your spot!​-----------------------------------------------------------------​About the Organizers​GenZteais a community of Gen Z founders, creators,and investors that brings Gen Z not just in the room, but at the table.​Christians in Techwas founded by Andy Choi to create community and support for Christians working in the technology sector. The organization focuses on integrating faith with professional life in the tech industry.​TechWalkwas created by Christine Farrier Rosemin as a platform for meaningful connection in the tech community through guided walks that combine networking with mindfulness and movement.

events.name: aci-d trip : Kubota Loft Tour
events.description: ​There's a saying: to understand someone, look at their home. Join us for a rare tour of the loft shared by pioneering video artist Shigeko Kubota and her partner, Nam June Paik.This loft served as the personal residence of Kubota and Paik as well as the studio where some of their most iconic works came into being. Even if you aren’t super familiar with Kubota or Paik’s work yet, I think the opportunity to visit their actual residence + studio will be at the very least a fruitful, if not generative experience.​The Kubota Foundation doesn’t typically offer weekend access, but they have made a special exception for us, aci-d club, the greatest arts crafts interface-design club within a 10 minute vicinity of the Grand street L stop.—Shigeko Kubota (1937–2015) was a video artist who fused sculpture and moving image. She is perhaps best known for being one of the first artists to embrace the medium of video in the early 1970s. She pioneeredvideo sculpture—a hybrid form merging moving images with physical structures made of plywood, metal, mirrors, and water. These works, often evoking landscapes or memorials, extended video beyond the television screen, channeling what she called “the energy of electrons” into immersive, tactile forms.​As a key figure in Fluxus and the first video curator at Anthology Film Archives (1974–1982), Kubota played a vital role in legitimizing video as an art form. Her efforts helped shift video from experimental broadcast into the gallery, establishing it as a central medium in contemporary art. Her work is held in major collections worldwide, including MoMA, the Smithsonian, and Centre Pompidou.Nam June Paik (1932-2006) is considered the "Father of Video Art" and is also credited with the first use of the term "electronic super highway" to describe the future of telecommunications. His work explored the malleable nature of technology, and its effect on our sense of self, community, and faith.

We’ll have a-pou’s catered and perhaps some drinks, though we’d appreciate if y’all BYOB or any other snacks.​Whether you’ve attended multiple times, or just once, we appreciate you being part of the journey nonetheless.​::)—Hosted attelos.haus

events.name: aci-d trip : Brutalist Architecture Tour
events.description: ​Let’s marvel at the oppressive beauty of brutalist buildings, from iconic landmarks to hidden gems. Our journey begins in Tribeca, where we’ll stroll along the west side, ending at Washington Square Park. Along the way, we’ll explore architectural wonders such as the AT&T Long Lines Building and the Salt Shed.​During our tour, we’ll delve into the history of these buildings, discussing the visionary architects behind their design, their original purposes, and how they are utilized today. We’ll also explore the challenges and triumphs faced during their construction, adding depth to our understanding of these monumental structures.​This walking tour is at street level, so be sure to wear comfortable shoes and bring along a bottle of water!Note: if you're able, paying $20 helps sustain aci-d club and makes future events possible—we’d really appreciate your support!_Liza Paganois a lifelong New Yorker and a curious Creative Director with a love for all things design. She has a fondness for wabi-sabi philosophy, brutalist architecture, and a well-worn river stone. In her spare time, you’ll find her riding her bike all over NYC, always in search of that one special block she’s never seen before—and she always finds it.

events.description: ​Have a creative project you’ve been wanting to work on but can’t quite make the time for? Want to meet other designers in the city? Come hang with us!Show up with ideas and materials, leave with progress made, and a new friend or two.AGENDA7:00-7:30: intros7:30-8:30: work on (or start) a design project!8:30-9:00+: break into groups, share your WIPs, chat, mingle—Hosted attelos.haus
